00027 /*
00028  * Copyright 2014 Cray Inc, all rights reserved.
00029  * Author: Frank Zago.
00030  *
00031  * A few portions are extracted from llapi_layout_test.c
00032  *
00033  * The purpose of this test is to test the llapi fid related function
00034  * (fid2path, path2fid, ...)
00035  *
00036  * The program will exit as soon a non zero error code is returned.
00037  */
00038 
00039 #include <stdlib.h>
00040 #include <errno.h>
00041 #include <getopt.h>
00042 #include <fcntl.h>
00043 #include <unistd.h>
00044 #include <poll.h>
00045 #include <sys/ioctl.h>
00046 #include <time.h>
00047 
00048 #include <lustre/lustreapi.h>
00049 #include <lustre/lustre_idl.h>
00050 
00051 #define ERROR(fmt, ...)                                                 \
00052         fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s:%d: %s: " fmt "\n",                     \
00053                 program_invocation_short_name, __FILE__, __LINE__,      \
00054                 __func__, ## __VA_ARGS__);
00055 
00056 #define DIE(fmt, ...)                  \
00057         do {                           \
00058                 ERROR(fmt, ## __VA_ARGS__);     \
00059                 exit(EXIT_FAILURE);             \
00060         } while (0)
00061 
00062 #define ASSERTF(cond, fmt, ...)                                         \
00063         do {                                                            \
00064                 if (!(cond))                                            \
00065                         DIE("assertion '%s' failed: "fmt,               \
00066                             #cond, ## __VA_ARGS__);                     \
00067         } while (0)
00068 
00069 #define PERFORM(testfn) \
00070         do {                                                            \
00071                 cleanup();                                              \
00072                 fprintf(stderr, "Starting test " #testfn " at %lld\n",  \
00073                         (unsigned long long)time(NULL));                \
00074                 testfn();                                               \
00075                 fprintf(stderr, "Finishing test " #testfn " at %lld\n", \
00076                        (unsigned long long)time(NULL));                 \
00077                 cleanup();                                              \
00078         } while (0)
00079 
00080 /* Name of file/directory. Will be set once and will not change. */
00081 static char mainpath[PATH_MAX];
00082 static const char *maindir = "llapi_fid_test_name_9585766";
00083 
00084 static char fsmountdir[PATH_MAX];       /* Lustre mountpoint */
00085 static char *lustre_dir;                /* Test directory inside Lustre */
00086 
00087 /* Cleanup our test directory. */
00088 static void cleanup(void)
00089 {
00090         char cmd[PATH_MAX];
00091         int rc;
00092 
00093         rc = snprintf(cmd, sizeof(cmd), "rm -rf -- '%s'", mainpath);
00094         ASSERTF(rc > 0 && rc < sizeof(cmd),
00095                 "invalid delete command for path '%s'", mainpath);
00096         rc = system(cmd);
00097         ASSERTF(rc != -1, "Cannot execute rm command");
00098         ASSERTF(WEXITSTATUS(rc) == 0,
00099                 "rm command returned %d", WEXITSTATUS(rc));
00100 }
00101 
00102 /* Helper - call path2fid, fd2fid and fid2path against an existing
00103  * file/directory */
00104 static void helper_fid2path(const char *filename, int fd)
00105 {
00106         lustre_fid fid;
00107         lustre_fid fid2;
00108         lustre_fid fid3;
00109         char fidstr[FID_LEN + 1];
00110         char path1[PATH_MAX];
00111         char path2[PATH_MAX];
00112         char path3[PATH_MAX];
00113         long long recno1;
00114         long long recno2;
00115         int linkno1;
00116         int linkno2;
00117         int rc;
00118 
00119         rc = llapi_path2fid(filename, &fid);
00120         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_path2fid failed for '%s': %s",
00121                 filename, strerror(-rc));
00122 
00123         /* Without braces */
00124         snprintf(fidstr, sizeof(fidstr), DFID_NOBRACE, PFID(&fid));
00125         recno1 = -1;
00126         linkno1 = 0;
00127         rc = llapi_fid2path(lustre_dir, fidstr, path1,
00128                             sizeof(path1), &recno1, &linkno1);
00129         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_fid2path failed for fid %s: %s",
00130                 fidstr, strerror(-rc));
00131 
00132         /* Same with braces */
00133         snprintf(fidstr, sizeof(fidstr), DFID, PFID(&fid));
00134         recno2 = -1;
00135         linkno2 = 0;
00136         rc = llapi_fid2path(lustre_dir, fidstr, path2,
00137                             sizeof(path2), &recno2, &linkno2);
00138         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_fid2path failed for fid %s: %s",
00139                 fidstr, strerror(-rc));
00140 
00141         /* Make sure both calls to llapi_fid2path returned the same
00142          * data. */
00143         ASSERTF(strcmp(path1, path2) == 0, "paths are different: '%s' / '%s'",
00144                 path1, path2);
00145         ASSERTF(recno1 == recno2, "recnos are different: %lld / %lld",
00146                 recno1, recno2);
00147         ASSERTF(linkno1 == linkno2, "linknos are different: %d / %d",
00148                 linkno1, linkno2);
00149 
00150         /* Try fd2fid and check that the result is still the same. */
00151         if (fd != -1) {
00152                 rc = llapi_fd2fid(fd, &fid3);
00153                 ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_fd2fid failed for '%s': %s",
00154                         mainpath, strerror(-rc));
00155 
00156                 ASSERTF(memcmp(&fid, &fid3, sizeof(fid)) == 0,
00157                         "fids are different");
00158         }
00159 
00160         /* Pass the result back to fid2path and ensure the fid stays
00161          * the same. */
00162         rc = snprintf(path3, sizeof(path3), "%s/%s", fsmountdir, path1);
00163         ASSERTF((rc > 0 && rc < sizeof(path3)), "invalid name");
00164         rc = llapi_path2fid(path3, &fid2);
00165         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_path2fid failed for '%s': %s",
00166                 path3, strerror(-rc));
00167         ASSERTF(memcmp(&fid, &fid2, sizeof(fid)) == 0, "fids are different");
00168 }
00169 
00170 /* Test helper_fid2path */
00171 static void test10(void)
00172 {
00173         int rc;
00174         int fd;
00175         struct stat statbuf;
00176 
00177         /* Against Lustre root */
00178         helper_fid2path(lustre_dir, -1);
00179 
00180         /* Against a regular file */
00181         fd = creat(mainpath, 0);
00182         ASSERTF(fd >= 0, "creat failed for '%s': %s",
00183                 mainpath, strerror(errno));
00184         helper_fid2path(mainpath, fd);
00185         close(fd);
00186         rc = unlink(mainpath);
00187         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "unlink failed for '%s': %s",
00188                 mainpath, strerror(errno));
00189 
00190         /* Against a pipe */
00191         rc = mkfifo(mainpath, 0);
00192         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "mkfifo failed for '%s': %s",
00193                 mainpath, strerror(errno));
00194         helper_fid2path(mainpath, -1);
00195         rc = unlink(mainpath);
00196         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "unlink failed for '%s': %s",
00197                 mainpath, strerror(errno));
00198 
00199         /* Against a directory */
00200         rc = mkdir(mainpath, 0);
00201         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "mkdir failed for '%s': %s",
00202                 mainpath, strerror(errno));
00203         helper_fid2path(mainpath, -1);
00204         rc = rmdir(mainpath);
00205         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "rmdir failed for '%s': %s",
00206                 mainpath, strerror(errno));
00207 
00208         /* Against a char device. Use same as /dev/null in case things
00209          * go wrong. */
00210         rc = stat("/dev/null", &statbuf);
00211         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "stat failed for /dev/null: %s", strerror(errno));
00212         rc = mknod(mainpath, S_IFCHR, statbuf.st_rdev);
00213         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "mknod failed for '%s': %s",
00214                 mainpath, strerror(errno));
00215         helper_fid2path(mainpath, -1);
00216         rc = unlink(mainpath);
00217         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "unlink failed for '%s': %s",
00218                 mainpath, strerror(errno));
00219 
00220         /* Against a block device device. Reuse same dev. */
00221         rc = mknod(mainpath, S_IFBLK, statbuf.st_rdev);
00222         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "mknod failed for '%s': %s",
00223                 mainpath, strerror(errno));
00224         helper_fid2path(mainpath, -1);
00225         rc = unlink(mainpath);
00226         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "unlink failed for '%s': %s",
00227                 mainpath, strerror(errno));
00228 
00229         /* Against a socket. */
00230         rc = mknod(mainpath, S_IFSOCK, (dev_t)0);
00231         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "mknod failed for '%s': %s",
00232                 mainpath, strerror(errno));
00233         helper_fid2path(mainpath, -1);
00234         rc = unlink(mainpath);
00235         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "unlink failed for '%s': %s",
00236                 mainpath, strerror(errno));
00237 }
00238 
00239 /* Test against deleted files. */
00240 static void test11(void)
00241 {
00242         int rc;
00243         int fd;
00244         lustre_fid fid;
00245         char fidstr[FID_LEN + 1];
00246         char path[PATH_MAX];
00247         long long recno;
00248         int linkno;
00249 
00250         /* Against a regular file */
00251         fd = creat(mainpath, 0);
00252         ASSERTF(fd >= 0, "creat failed for '%s': %s",
00253                 mainpath, strerror(errno));
00254         close(fd);
00255 
00256         rc = llapi_path2fid(mainpath, &fid);
00257         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_path2fid failed for '%s': %s",
00258                 mainpath, strerror(-rc));
00259 
00260         rc = unlink(mainpath);
00261         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "unlink failed for '%s': %s",
00262                 mainpath, strerror(errno));
00263 
00264         snprintf(fidstr, sizeof(fidstr), DFID_NOBRACE, PFID(&fid));
00265         recno = -1;
00266         linkno = 0;
00267         rc = llapi_fid2path(lustre_dir, fidstr, path,
00268                             sizeof(path), &recno, &linkno);
00269         ASSERTF(rc == -ENOENT, "llapi_fid2path failed for fid %s: %s",
00270                 fidstr, strerror(-rc));
00271 }
00272 
00273 /* Test volatile file. */
00274 static void test12(void)
00275 {
00276         int rc;
00277         int fd;
00278         int fd2;
00279         int fd3;
00280         lustre_fid fid;
00281 
00282         /* Against a volatile file */
00283         rc = mkdir(mainpath, 0);
00284         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "mkdir failed for '%s': %s",
00285                 mainpath, strerror(errno));
00286         fd = llapi_create_volatile_idx(mainpath, -1, 0600);
00287         ASSERTF(fd >= 0, "creat failed for '%s': %s",
00288                 mainpath, strerror(errno));
00289 
00290         rc = llapi_fd2fid(fd, &fid);
00291         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_path2fid failed for '%s': %s",
00292                 mainpath, strerror(-rc));
00293 
00294         /* No many ways to test, except to open by fid. */
00295         fd2 = llapi_open_by_fid(mainpath, &fid, 0600);
00296         ASSERTF(fd2 >= 0, "llapi_open_by_fid for " DFID_NOBRACE ": %s",
00297                 PFID(&fid), strerror(errno));
00298 
00299         close(fd);
00300 
00301         /* Check the file can still be opened, since fd2 is not
00302          * closed. */
00303         fd3 = llapi_open_by_fid(mainpath, &fid, 0600);
00304         ASSERTF(fd3 >= 0, "llapi_open_by_fid for " DFID_NOBRACE ": %s",
00305                 PFID(&fid), strerror(errno));
00306 
00307         close(fd2);
00308         close(fd3);
00309 
00310         /* The volatile file is gone now. */
00311         fd = llapi_open_by_fid(mainpath, &fid, 0600);
00312         ASSERTF(fd < 0, "llapi_open_by_fid for " DFID_NOBRACE ": %d",
00313                 PFID(&fid), fd);
00314 }
00315 
00316 /* Test with sub directories */
00317 static void test20(void)
00318 {
00319         char testpath[PATH_MAX];
00320         size_t len;
00321         int dir_created = 0;
00322         int rc;
00323 
00324         rc = snprintf(testpath, sizeof(testpath), "%s", mainpath);
00325         ASSERTF((rc > 0 && rc < sizeof(testpath)),
00326                 "invalid name for testpath '%s'", mainpath);
00327 
00328         rc = mkdir(testpath, S_IRWXU);
00329         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "mkdir failed for '%s': %s",
00330                 testpath, strerror(errno));
00331 
00332         len = strlen(testpath);
00333 
00334         /* Create subdirectories as long as we can. Each new subdir is
00335          * "/x", so we need at least 3 characters left in testpath. */
00336         while (len <= sizeof(testpath) - 3) {
00337                 strncat(testpath, "/x", 2);
00338 
00339                 len += 2;
00340 
00341                 rc = mkdir(testpath, S_IRWXU);
00342                 ASSERTF(rc == 0, "mkdir failed for '%s': %s",
00343                         testpath, strerror(errno));
00344 
00345                 dir_created++;
00346 
00347                 helper_fid2path(testpath, -1);
00348         }
00349 
00350         /* And test the last one. */
00351         helper_fid2path(testpath, -1);
00352 
00353         /* Make sure we have created enough directories. Even with a
00354          * reasonably long mountpath, we should have created at least
00355          * 2000. */
00356         ASSERTF(dir_created >= 2000, "dir_created=%d -- '%s'",
00357                 dir_created, testpath);
00358 }
00359 
00360 /* Test linkno from fid2path */
00361 static void test30(void)
00362 {
00363         /* Note that since the links are stored in the extended
00364          * attributes, only a few of these will fit (about 150 in this
00365          * test). Still, create more than that to ensure the system
00366          * doesn't break. See LU-5746. */
00367         const int num_links = 1000;
00368         struct {
00369                 char filename[PATH_MAX];
00370                 bool seen;
00371         } links[num_links];
00372         char buf[PATH_MAX];
00373         char buf2[PATH_MAX];
00374         lustre_fid fid;
00375         char fidstr[FID_LEN + 1];
00376         int rc;
00377         int i;
00378         int j;
00379         int fd;
00380         int linkno;
00381         bool past_link_limit = false;
00382 
00383         /* Create the containing directory. */
00384         rc = mkdir(mainpath, 0);
00385         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "mkdir failed for '%s': %s",
00386                 mainpath, strerror(errno));
00387 
00388         /* Initializes the link array. */
00389         for (i = 0; i < num_links; i++) {
00390                 rc = snprintf(links[i].filename, sizeof(links[i].filename),
00391                               "%s/%s/link%04d", lustre_dir, maindir, i);
00392 
00393                 ASSERTF((rc > 0 && rc < sizeof(links[i].filename)),
00394                         "invalid name for link");
00395 
00396                 links[i].seen = false;
00397         }
00398 
00399         /* Create the original file. */
00400         fd = creat(links[0].filename, 0);
00401         ASSERTF(fd >= 0, "create failed for '%s': %s",
00402                 links[0].filename, strerror(errno));
00403         close(fd);
00404 
00405         rc = llapi_path2fid(links[0].filename, &fid);
00406         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_path2fid failed for '%s': %s",
00407                 links[0].filename, strerror(-rc));
00408         snprintf(fidstr, sizeof(fidstr), DFID_NOBRACE, PFID(&fid));
00409 
00410         /* Create the links */
00411         for (i = 1; i < num_links; i++) {
00412                 rc = link(links[0].filename, links[i].filename);
00413                 ASSERTF(rc == 0, "link failed for '%s' / '%s': %s",
00414                         links[0].filename, links[i].filename, strerror(errno));
00415         }
00416 
00417         /* Query the links, making sure we got all of them */
00418         for (i = 0; i < num_links + 10; i++) {
00419                 long long recno;
00420                 bool found;
00421 
00422                 /* Without braces */
00423                 recno = -1;
00424                 linkno = i;
00425                 rc = llapi_fid2path(links[0].filename, fidstr, buf,
00426                                     sizeof(buf), &recno, &linkno);
00427                 ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_fid2path failed for fid %s: %s",
00428                         fidstr, strerror(-rc));
00429 
00430                 snprintf(buf2, sizeof(buf2), "%s/%s", fsmountdir, buf);
00431 
00432                 if (past_link_limit == false) {
00433                         /* Find the name in the links that were created */
00434                         found = false;
00435                         for (j = 0; j < num_links; j++) {
00436                                 if (strcmp(buf2, links[j].filename) == 0) {
00437                                         ASSERTF(links[j].seen == false,
00438                                                 "link '%s' already seen",
00439                                                 links[j].filename);
00440                                         links[j].seen = true;
00441                                         found = true;
00442                                         break;
00443                                 }
00444                         }
00445                         ASSERTF(found == true, "link '%s' not found", buf2);
00446 
00447                         if (linkno == i) {
00448                                 /* The linkno hasn't changed. This
00449                                  * means it is the last entry
00450                                  * stored. */
00451                                 past_link_limit = true;
00452 
00453                                 fprintf(stderr,
00454                                         "Was able to store %d links in the EA\n",
00455                                         i);
00456 
00457                                 /* Also assume that some links were
00458                                  * returned. It's hard to compute the
00459                                  * exact value. */
00460                                 ASSERTF(i > 50,
00461                                         "not enough links were returned: %d",
00462                                         i);
00463                         }
00464                 } else {
00465                         /* Past the number of links stored in the EA,
00466                          * Lustre will simply return the original
00467                          * file. */
00468                         ASSERTF(strcmp(buf2, links[0].filename) == 0,
00469                                        "unexpected link for record %d: '%s' / '%s'",
00470                                        i, buf2, links[0].filename);
00471                 }
00472 
00473         }
00474 }
00475 
00476 /* Test llapi_fd2parent/llapi_path2parent on mainpath (whatever its
00477  * type). mainpath must exist. */
00478 static void help_test40(void)
00479 {
00480         lustre_fid parent_fid;
00481         lustre_fid fid2;
00482         char buf[PATH_MAX];
00483         int rc;
00484 
00485         /* Successful call */
00486         memset(buf, 0x55, sizeof(buf));
00487         rc = llapi_path2parent(mainpath, 0, &parent_fid, buf, PATH_MAX);
00488         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_path2parent failed for '%s': %s",
00489                 mainpath, strerror(errno));
00490         ASSERTF(strcmp(buf, maindir) == 0, "paths are different: '%s' / '%s'",
00491                 buf, maindir);
00492 
00493         /* By construction, mainpath is just under lustre_dir, so we
00494          * can check that the parent fid of mainpath is indeed the one
00495          * of lustre_dir. */
00496         rc = llapi_path2fid(lustre_dir, &fid2);
00497         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_path2fid failed for '%s': %s",
00498                 lustre_dir, strerror(-rc));
00499         ASSERTF(memcmp(&parent_fid, &fid2, sizeof(fid2)) == 0,
00500                 "fids are different");
00501 
00502         /* Name too short */
00503         rc = llapi_path2parent(mainpath, 0, &parent_fid, buf, 0);
00504         ASSERTF(rc == -EOVERFLOW, "llapi_path2parent error: %s", strerror(-rc));
00505 
00506         rc = llapi_path2parent(mainpath, 0, &parent_fid, buf, 5);
00507         ASSERTF(rc == -EOVERFLOW, "llapi_path2parent error: %s", strerror(-rc));
00508 
00509         rc = llapi_path2parent(mainpath, 0, &parent_fid, buf, strlen(maindir));
00510         ASSERTF(rc == -EOVERFLOW, "llapi_path2parent error: %s", strerror(-rc));
00511 
00512         rc = llapi_path2parent(mainpath, 0, &parent_fid, buf,
00513                                strlen(maindir)+1);
00514         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_path2parent failed: %s", strerror(-rc));
00515 }
00516 
00517 static void test40(void)
00518 {
00519         int fd;
00520         int rc;
00521 
00522         /* Against a directory. */
00523         rc = mkdir(mainpath, 0);
00524         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "mkdir failed for '%s': %s",
00525                 mainpath, strerror(errno));
00526         help_test40();
00527 
00528         cleanup();
00529 
00530         /* Against a regular file */
00531         fd = creat(mainpath, 0);
00532         ASSERTF(fd >= 0, "creat failed for '%s': %s",
00533                 mainpath, strerror(errno));
00534         close(fd);
00535 }
00536 
00537 /* Test LL_IOC_GETPARENT directly */
00538 static void test41(void)
00539 {
00540         int rc;
00541         int fd;
00542         int i;
00543         union {
00544                 struct getparent gp;
00545                 char buf[1024];
00546         } u;
00547 
00548         /* Against a regular file */
00549         fd = creat(mainpath, 0);
00550         ASSERTF(fd >= 0, "creat failed for '%s': %s",
00551                 mainpath, strerror(errno));
00552 
00553         /* Ask a few times */
00554         for (i = 0; i < 256; i++) {
00555                 memset(u.buf, i, sizeof(u.buf)); /* poison */
00556                 u.gp.gp_linkno = 0;
00557                 u.gp.gp_name_size = 100;
00558 
00559                 rc = ioctl(fd, LL_IOC_GETPARENT, &u.gp);
00560                 ASSERTF(rc == 0, "LL_IOC_GETPARENT failed: %s, rc=%d",
00561                         strerror(errno), rc);
00562                 ASSERTF(strcmp(u.gp.gp_name, maindir) == 0,
00563                         "strings are different: %zd, %zd",
00564                         strlen(u.gp.gp_name), strlen(maindir));
00565         }
00566 
00567         close(fd);
00568 }
00569 
00570 /* Test with linkno. Create sub directories, and put a link to the
00571  * original file in them. */
00572 static void test42(void)
00573 {
00574 
00575         const int num_links = 100;
00576         struct {
00577                 char subdir[PATH_MAX];
00578                 lustre_fid subdir_fid;
00579                 char filename[PATH_MAX];
00580                 bool seen;
00581         } links[num_links];
00582         char link0[PATH_MAX];
00583         char buf[PATH_MAX];
00584         int rc;
00585         int i;
00586         int fd;
00587         int linkno;
00588         lustre_fid parent_fid;
00589 
00590         /* Create the containing directory. */
00591         rc = mkdir(mainpath, 0);
00592         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "mkdir failed: for '%s': %s",
00593                 mainpath, strerror(errno));
00594 
00595         /* Initializes the link array. */
00596         for (i = 0; i < num_links; i++) {
00597                 rc = snprintf(links[i].subdir, sizeof(links[i].subdir),
00598                               "%s/sub%04d", mainpath, i);
00599                 ASSERTF((rc > 0 && rc < sizeof(links[i].subdir)),
00600                         "invalid name for subdir");
00601 
00602                 rc = snprintf(links[i].filename, sizeof(links[i].filename),
00603                               "link%04d", i);
00604                 ASSERTF((rc > 0 && rc < sizeof(links[i].filename)),
00605                         "invalid name for link");
00606 
00607                 links[i].seen = false;
00608         }
00609 
00610         /* Create the subdirectories. */
00611         for (i = 0; i < num_links; i++) {
00612                 rc = mkdir(links[i].subdir, S_IRWXU);
00613                 ASSERTF(rc == 0, "mkdir failed for '%s': %s",
00614                         links[i].subdir, strerror(errno));
00615 
00616                 rc = llapi_path2fid(links[i].subdir, &links[i].subdir_fid);
00617                 ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_path2fid failed for '%s': %s",
00618                         links[i].subdir, strerror(-rc));
00619         }
00620 
00621         /* Create the original file. */
00622         rc = snprintf(link0, sizeof(link0), "%s/%s",
00623                       links[0].subdir, links[0].filename);
00624         ASSERTF((rc > 0 && rc < sizeof(link0)), "invalid name for file");
00625 
00626         fd = creat(link0, 0);
00627         ASSERTF(fd >= 0, "create failed for '%s': %s", link0, strerror(errno));
00628         close(fd);
00629 
00630         /* Create the links */
00631         for (i = 1; i < num_links; i++) {
00632                 rc = snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), "%s/%s",
00633                               links[i].subdir, links[i].filename);
00634                 ASSERTF((rc > 0 && rc < sizeof(buf)),
00635                         "invalid name for link %d", i);
00636 
00637                 rc = link(link0, buf);
00638                 ASSERTF(rc == 0, "link failed for '%s' / '%s': %s",
00639                         link0, buf, strerror(errno));
00640         }
00641 
00642         /* Query the links, making sure we got all of them. Do it in
00643          * reverse order, just because! */
00644         for (linkno = num_links-1; linkno >= 0; linkno--) {
00645                 bool found;
00646 
00647                 rc = llapi_path2parent(link0, linkno, &parent_fid, buf,
00648                                        sizeof(buf));
00649                 ASSERTF(rc == 0, "llapi_path2parent failed for '%s': %s",
00650                         link0, strerror(-rc));
00651 
00652                 /* Find the name in the links that were created */
00653                 found = false;
00654                 for (i = 0; i < num_links; i++) {
00655                         if (memcmp(&parent_fid, &links[i].subdir_fid,
00656                                    sizeof(parent_fid)) != 0)
00657                                 continue;
00658 
00659                         ASSERTF(strcmp(links[i].filename, buf) == 0,
00660                                 "name differ: '%s' / '%s'",
00661                                 links[i].filename, buf);
00662                         ASSERTF(links[i].seen == false,
00663                                 "link '%s' already seen", links[i].filename);
00664                         links[i].seen = true;
00665                         found = true;
00666                         break;
00667                 }
00668                 ASSERTF(found == true, "link '%s' not found", buf);
00669         }
00670 
00671         /* check non existent n+1 link */
00672         rc = llapi_path2parent(link0, num_links, &parent_fid, buf, sizeof(buf));
00673         ASSERTF(rc == -ENODATA, "llapi_path2parent error for '%s': %s",
00674                 link0, strerror(-rc));
00675 }
00676 
00677 static void usage(char *prog)
00678 {
00679         fprintf(stderr, "Usage: %s [-d lustre_dir]\n", prog);
00680         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00681 }
00682 
00683 static void process_args(int argc, char *argv[])
00684 {
00685         int c;
00686 
00687         while ((c = getopt(argc, argv, "d:")) != -1) {
00688                 switch (c) {
00689                 case 'd':
00690                         lustre_dir = optarg;
00691                         break;
00692                 case '?':
00693                 default:
00694                         fprintf(stderr, "Unknown option '%c'\n", optopt);
00695                         usage(argv[0]);
00696                 }
00697         }
00698 }
00699 
00700 int main(int argc, char *argv[])
00701 {
00702         char fsname[8 + 1];
00703         int rc;
00704 
00705         process_args(argc, argv);
00706         if (lustre_dir == NULL)
00707                 lustre_dir = "/mnt/lustre";
00708 
00709         rc = llapi_search_mounts(lustre_dir, 0, fsmountdir, fsname);
00710         if (rc != 0) {
00711                 fprintf(stderr, "Error: %s: not a Lustre filesystem\n",
00712                         lustre_dir);
00713                 return EXIT_FAILURE;
00714         }
00715 
00716         /* Play nice with Lustre test scripts. Non-line buffered output
00717          * stream under I/O redirection may appear incorrectly. */
00718         setvbuf(stdout, NULL, _IOLBF, 0);
00719 
00720         /* Create a test filename and reuse it. Remove possibly old files. */
00721         rc = snprintf(mainpath, sizeof(mainpath), "%s/%s", lustre_dir, maindir);
00722         ASSERTF((rc > 0 && rc < sizeof(mainpath)), "invalid name for mainpath");
00723         cleanup();
00724 
00725         atexit(cleanup);
00726 
00727         PERFORM(test10);
00728         PERFORM(test11);
00729         PERFORM(test12);
00730         PERFORM(test20);
00731         PERFORM(test30);
00732         PERFORM(test40);
00733         PERFORM(test41);
00734         PERFORM(test42);
00735 
00736         return EXIT_SUCCESS;
00737 }
